newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Italy's Cogeco wins $167 mln Hungary rail tender.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Cogeco wins $167 mln Hungary rail tender.

text.p: Italy's Cogeco has won a 27.4 billion forints ($167 million) tender to equip and run the electrical equpiment of 256 kilometres of electrified rail track in Hungary, the Transport Ministry said on Tuesday.
The concession contract will be signed on Wednesday, the ministry said in a statement.

The electrification of the three regional tracks will be financed by a loan from Germany's Kreditanstalt fur Wiederaufbau and the building subcontractor will be Germany's Siemens AG, the ministry said.
Work is expected to begin in the first quarter of 1997 and will take some three years, the statement said.
